20101231143323.000|20101231143325.000|TR0|different this year, cameras like these in 
20101231143325.000|20101231143327.000|TR0|Time Square now feed into this nerve 
20101231143327.000|20101231143330.000|TR0|center. Authorities say there are roughly 
20101231143330.000|20101231143332.000|TR0|400 police and private cameras just in the 
20101231143332.000|20101231143334.000|TR0|Time Square area that can be monitored.
20101231143334.000|20101231143337.000|TR0|
20101231143337.000|20101231143339.000|TR0|The private sector also works with the 
20101231143339.000|20101231143342.000|TR0|police.  Tim Tompkins, president of the 
20101231143342.000|20101231143344.000|TR0|Times Square Alliance, says people staying 
20101231143344.000|20101231143346.000|TR0|in hotels in Time Square are restricted in 
20101231143346.000|20101231143349.000|TR0|terms of where they can go.
20101231143349.000|20101231143351.000|TR0|
20101231143351.000|20101231143353.000|TR0|TIM TOMPKINS, PRES., TIMES SQUARE 
20101231143353.000|20101231143356.000|TR0|ALLIANCE:  People may think I'm in a 
20101231143356.000|20101231143358.000|TR0|hotel, I can just wander into Time Square. 
20101231143358.000|20101231143400.000|TR0| Absolutely not. It's very, very 
20101231143400.000|20101231143403.000|TR0|controlled in terms of who gets out into 
20101231143403.000|20101231143405.000|TR0|the street. Once the pens are filled, it 
20101231143405.000|20101231143407.000|TR0|really is lockdown.
20101231143407.000|20101231143410.000|TR0|
20101231143410.000|20101231143412.000|TR0|SNOW:  Tompkins estimates the crowd could 
20101231143412.000|20101231143414.000|TR0|be anywhere from 750,000 to 1 million 
20101231143414.000|20101231143417.000|TR0|people.
20101231143417.000|20101231143419.000|TR0|
20101231143419.000|20101231143422.000|TR0|KELLY:  It is a big, complex operation.  
20101231143422.000|20101231143424.000|TR0|And, you know, you always breathe a sigh 
20101231143424.000|20101231143426.000|TR0|of relief when it's -- when it's over.
20101231143426.000|20101231143429.000|TR0|
20101231143429.000|20101231143431.000|TR0|SNOW (on camera):  The police commissioner 
20101231143431.000|20101231143433.000|TR0|says that recent terror-related arrests in 
20101231143433.000|20101231143436.000|TR0|Europe have given the NYPD, in his words, 
20101231143436.000|20101231143438.000|TR0|some cause for concern.  But he says there 
20101231143438.000|20101231143440.000|TR0|are no specific threats against New York 
20101231143440.000|20101231143443.000|TR0|City.
20101231143443.000|20101231143445.000|TR0|
20101231143445.000|20101231143447.000|TR0|Mary Snow, CNN, New York.
20101231143447.000|20101231143450.000|TR0|
20101231143450.000|20101231143452.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20101231143452.000|20101231143454.000|TR0|
20101231143454.000|20101231143457.000|TR0|CHO:  And we have breaking news just 
20101231143457.000|20101231143459.000|TR0|coming in from the Seattle area.  These 
20101231143459.000|20101231143502.000|TR0|pictures courtesy of KIRO, our affiliate 
20101231143502.000|20101231143504.000|TR0|out there.  This is in Ballard, 
20101231143504.000|20101231143506.000|TR0|Washington, where we're told that six 
20101231143506.000|20101231143509.000|TR0|people had to be rescued from a house fire.
20101231143509.000|20101231143511.000|TR0|

20101231143513.000|20101231143516.000|TR0|were taken to the hospital.  One of the 
20101231143516.000|20101231143518.000|TR0|eight people injured apparently in 
20101231143518.000|20101231143520.000|TR0|critical condition.  According to "The 
20101231143520.000|20101231143523.000|TR0|Seattle Times," the cause of the fire was 
20101231143523.000|20101231143525.000|TR0|accidental -- from overheated electrical 
20101231143525.000|20101231143527.000|TR0|wiring.
20101231143527.000|20101231143530.000|TR0|
20101231143530.000|20101231143532.000|TR0|We are following the breaking news.  We'll 
20101231143532.000|20101231143535.000|TR0|bring you more details as they come into 
20101231143535.000|20101231143537.000|TR0|our newsroom.
20101231143537.000|20101231143539.000|TR0|
20101231143539.000|20101231143542.000|TR0|New Year's resolutions -- most of us make 
20101231143542.000|20101231143544.000|TR0|them, but how many of us actually keep 
20101231143544.000|20101231143546.000|TR0|them?  On CNN's AMERICAN MORNING, clinical 
20101231143546.000|20101231143549.000|TR0|psychologist Jeff Gardere offered some 
20101231143549.000|20101231143551.000|TR0|tips on seeing them through.
20101231143551.000|20101231143553.000|TR0|
20101231143553.000|20101231143556.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143556.000|20101231143558.000|TR0|
20101231143558.000|20101231143600.000|TR0|JEFF GARDERE, CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGIST:  You 
20101231143600.000|20101231143603.000|TR0|have to be specific in your goals.  
20101231143603.000|20101231143605.000|TR0|Everyone's all over the place with the 
20101231143605.000|20101231143607.000|TR0|goals.  They're too broad.  They're not 
20101231143607.000|20101231143610.000|TR0|achievable.  They're not planning them. 
20101231143610.000|20101231143612.000|TR0|They're not well-thought out.  They're 
20101231143612.000|20101231143615.000|TR0|just throwing everything --
20101231143615.000|20101231143617.000|TR0|
20101231143617.000|20101231143619.000|TR0|CHRISTINE ROMANS, CNN ANCHOR:  It's an 
20101231143619.000|20101231143622.000|TR0|idea.  It's not a goal.
20101231143622.000|20101231143624.000|TR0|
20101231143624.000|20101231143626.000|TR0|GARDERE:  Exactly.
20101231143626.000|20101231143629.000|TR0|
20101231143629.000|20101231143631.000|TR0|ROMANS:  What I want to be, but you have 
20101231143631.000|20101231143633.000|TR0|to work to attain goals.
20101231143633.000|20101231143636.000|TR0|
20101231143636.000|20101231143638.000|TR0|GARDERE:  Well, yes, and they're going 
20101231143638.000|20101231143640.000|TR0|with the spirit and the spirit is good 
20101231143640.000|20101231143643.000|TR0|when you're setting resolutions because 
20101231143643.000|20101231143645.000|TR0|studies show that people who do set 
20101231143645.000|20101231143647.000|TR0|resolutions this time of the year are 10 
20101231143647.000|20101231143650.000|TR0|times more likely to achieve their goals 
20101231143650.000|20101231143652.000|TR0|but these are people who work at it and 
20101231143652.000|20101231143655.000|TR0|that's what's most important.
20101231143655.000|20101231143657.000|TR0|
20101231143657.000|20101231143659.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143659.000|20101231143702.000|TR0|
20101231143702.000|20101231143704.000|TR0|CHO:  That's good advice.  So, is this -- 
20101231143704.000|20101231143706.000|TR0|Gardere says, most of all, if you fail to 
20101231143706.000|20101231143709.000|TR0|keep your resolution, forgive yourself, 
20101231143709.000|20101231143711.000|TR0|and then try again.
20101231143711.000|20101231143713.000|TR0|
20101231143713.000|20101231143716.000|TR0|Well, just hours left in 2010, which means 
20101231143716.000|20101231143718.000|TR0|we have one last chance to look back at 
20101231143718.000|20101231143720.000|TR0|some of the wild and weird political 
20101231143720.000|20101231143723.000|TR0|stories from the year.
20101231143723.000|20101231143725.000|TR0|
20101231143725.000|20101231143727.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101231143727.000|20101231143730.000|TR0|
20101231143730.000|20101231143732.000|TR0|CANDY CROWLEY, CNN CHIEF POLITICAL 
20101231143732.000|20101231143735.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  I'm Candy Crowley with the 
20101231143735.000|20101231143737.000|TR0|top 10 political moments of 2010.
20101231143737.000|20101231143739.000|TR0|
20101231143739.000|20101231143742.000|TR0|At number 10: a big no-no in the Florida 
20101231143742.000|20101231143744.000|TR0|governor's debate. Democratic nominee Alex 
20101231143744.000|20101231143746.000|TR0|Sink broke the rules when her makeup 
20101231143746.000|20101231143749.000|TR0|artist showed her a cell phone message 
20101231143749.000|20101231143751.000|TR0|during a commercial break of the debate.  
20101231143751.000|20101231143753.000|TR0|Her opponent, Republican Rick Scott, saw 
20101231143753.000|20101231143756.000|TR0|it and called her out.
20101231143756.000|20101231143758.000|TR0|
20101231143758.000|20101231143800.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143800.000|20101231143803.000|TR0|
20101231143803.000|20101231143805.000|TR0|RICK SCOTT (R), THEN-FLORIDA GUBERNATORIAL 
20101231143805.000|20101231143808.000|TR0|CANDIDATE:  First, Alex, you say you 
20101231143808.000|20101231143810.000|TR0|always follow the rules.  The rule was no 
20101231143810.000|20101231143812.000|TR0|one is supposed to give us messages during 
20101231143812.000|20101231143815.000|TR0|the break and your campaign did with an 
20101231143815.000|20101231143817.000|TR0|iPad, or iPod.
20101231143817.000|20101231143819.000|TR0|
20101231143819.000|20101231143822.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143822.000|20101231143824.000|TR0|
20101231143824.000|20101231143826.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  Sink said she couldn't even read 
20101231143826.000|20101231143829.000|TR0|the message since the text was so small, 
20101231143829.000|20101231143831.000|TR0|because she ended up firing the campaign 
20101231143831.000|20101231143833.000|TR0|staffer involved.
20101231143833.000|20101231143836.000|TR0|
20101231143836.000|20101231143838.000|TR0|At number nine: a tickle fight lands a 
20101231143838.000|20101231143840.000|TR0|U.S. congressman in hot wire.
20101231143840.000|20101231143843.000|TR0|
20101231143843.000|20101231143845.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143845.000|20101231143848.000|TR0|
20101231143848.000|20101231143850.000|TR0|LARRY KING, HOST, "LARRY KING LIVE":  A 
20101231143850.000|20101231143852.000|TR0|time ago, you said, quote, "Not only did I 
20101231143852.000|20101231143855.000|TR0|grope him, I tickled him until he couldn't 
20101231143855.000|20101231143857.000|TR0|breathe."
20101231143857.000|20101231143859.000|TR0|
20101231143859.000|20101231143902.000|TR0|ERIC MASSA (D), FORMER U.S. CONGRESSMAN:  
20101231143902.000|20101231143904.000|TR0|Larry, when you grab someone and you're 
20101231143904.000|20101231143906.000|TR0|wrestling, I don't know how to describe 
20101231143906.000|20101231143909.000|TR0|that word.
20101231143909.000|20101231143911.000|TR0|
20101231143911.000|20101231143913.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143913.000|20101231143916.000|TR0|
20101231143916.000|20101231143918.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  Congressman Eric Massa resigned 
20101231143918.000|20101231143920.000|TR0|his seats.  His reasons: recurring cancer 
20101231143920.000|20101231143923.000|TR0|and an ethics committee investigation into 
20101231143923.000|20101231143925.000|TR0|sexual harassment claims.
20101231143925.000|20101231143928.000|TR0|
20101231143928.000|20101231143930.000|TR0|At number eight, a false idol named Aqua 
20101231143930.000|20101231143932.000|TR0|Buddha.
20101231143932.000|20101231143935.000|TR0|
20101231143935.000|20101231143937.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143937.000|20101231143939.000|TR0|
20101231143939.000|20101231143942.000|TR0|NARRATOR:  Why did Rand Paul once tie a 
20101231143942.000|20101231143944.000|TR0|woman up, tell her to bow down before a 
20101231143944.000|20101231143946.000|TR0|false idol and say his god was Aqua Buddha?
20101231143946.000|20101231143949.000|TR0|
20101231143949.000|20101231143951.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231143951.000|20101231143953.000|TR0|
20101231143953.000|20101231143956.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  Yes, that ad from Democratic 
20101231143956.000|20101231143958.000|TR0|candidate Jack Conway made the phrase 
20101231143958.000|20101231144001.000|TR0|"Aqua Buddha" into a major issue in the 
20101231144001.000|20101231144003.000|TR0|Kentucky Senate race.  Conway used the ad 
20101231144003.000|20101231144005.000|TR0|to question the Christian faith of his 
20101231144005.000|20101231144008.000|TR0|Republican opponent Rand Paul.  To no 
20101231144008.000|20101231144010.000|TR0|avail, Paul won the November race.
20101231144010.000|20101231144012.000|TR0|
20101231144012.000|20101231144015.000|TR0|Number seven: another campaign ad, this 
20101231144015.000|20101231144017.000|TR0|one featuring a flock of "demon sheep."  
20101231144017.000|20101231144019.000|TR0|The ad came out during the primary 
20101231144019.000|20101231144022.000|TR0|campaign for California's Republican 
20101231144022.000|20101231144024.000|TR0|Senate nominee.  The campaign of former 
20101231144024.000|20101231144026.000|TR0|Hewlett-Packard CEO Carly Fiorina launched 
20101231144026.000|20101231144029.000|TR0|the ad, showing her opponent as the 
20101231144029.000|20101231144031.000|TR0|dangerous predator with glowing red eyes.  
20101231144031.000|20101231144033.000|TR0|Strategists questioned the strategy of 
20101231144033.000|20101231144036.000|TR0|portraying voters as dim-witted sheep. 
20101231144036.000|20101231144038.000|TR0|Fiorina won the nomination, but lost the 
20101231144038.000|20101231144041.000|TR0|election to incumbent Democrat, Barbara 
20101231144041.000|20101231144043.000|TR0|Boxer.
20101231144043.000|20101231144045.000|TR0|
20101231144045.000|20101231144048.000|TR0|And number six:

20101231144229.000|20101231144231.000|TR0|
20101231144231.000|20101231144234.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

20101231144250.000|20101231144252.000|TR0|out?

20101231144257.000|20101231144259.000|TR0|

20101231144302.000|20101231144304.000|TR0|
20101231144304.000|20101231144306.000|TR0|PALADINO:  Watch.
20101231144306.000|20101231144309.000|TR0|

20101231144311.000|20101231144314.000|TR0|
20101231144314.000|20101231144316.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231144316.000|20101231144318.000|TR0|
20101231144318.000|20101231144321.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  That's Paladino with a columnist 
20101231144321.000|20101231144323.000|TR0|whose newspaper had wring about a daughter 
20101231144323.000|20101231144325.000|TR0|Paladino had out of wedlock.  Paladino 
20101231144325.000|20101231144328.000|TR0|lost his race to Democrat Andrew Cuomo, 
20101231144328.000|20101231144330.000|TR0|but never let go of the thug image.  In 
20101231144330.000|20101231144332.000|TR0|his hand during his concession speech -- a 
20101231144332.000|20101231144335.000|TR0|baseball bat.
20101231144335.000|20101231144337.000|TR0|
20101231144337.000|20101231144339.000|TR0|At number four: the symbolism and emotion 
20101231144339.000|20101231144342.000|TR0|of the health care debate.  House Speaker 
20101231144342.000|20101231144344.000|TR0|Nancy Pelosi used a historic gavel.
20101231144344.000|20101231144346.000|TR0|
20101231144346.000|20101231144349.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231144349.000|20101231144351.000|TR0|
20101231144351.000|20101231144354.000|TR0|PELOSI:  I'm carrying this gavel that was 
20101231144354.000|20101231144356.000|TR0|just given to me -- correction -- lent to 
20101231144356.000|20101231144358.000|TR0|me by Chairman Dingell.  It was used in 
20101231144358.000|20101231144401.000|TR0|the enactment of the Medicare law.
20101231144401.000|20101231144403.000|TR0|
20101231144403.000|20101231144405.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231144405.000|20101231144408.000|TR0|
20101231144408.000|20101231144410.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  But before she gets to bang that 
20101231144410.000|20101231144412.000|TR0|gavel, tension ran high, Republican 
20101231144412.000|20101231144415.000|TR0|congressmen -- cheerleading and carrying 
20101231144415.000|20101231144417.000|TR0|handmade signs, and then there was the 
20101231144417.000|20101231144419.000|TR0|actual floor debate.
20101231144419.000|20101231144422.000|TR0|
20101231144422.000|20101231144424.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
20101231144424.000|20101231144427.000|TR0|
20101231144427.000|20101231144429.000|TR0|REP. JOHN LEWIS (D), GEORGIA:  Answer the 
20101231144429.000|20101231144431.000|TR0|call of history.
20101231144431.000|20101231144434.000|TR0|
20101231144434.000|20101231144436.000|TR0|REP. PAUL RYAN (R), WISCONSIN:  This bill 
20101231144436.000|20101231144438.000|TR0|is a fiscal Frankenstein.
20101231144438.000|20101231144441.000|TR0|
20101231144441.000|20101231144443.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20101231144443.000|20101231144445.000|TR0|
20101231144445.000|20101231144448.000|TR0|CROWLEY:  And real emotion from Republican 
20101231144448.000|20101231144450.000|TR0|Leader John Boehner on the House floor.
20101231144450.000|20101231144452.000|TR0|
